description.value: DO NOT ORBIT. Use manual piloting to make opponents chase you, lowering their transversal. You will not hit anything on autopilot orbit as your transversal will be too high. If you get scrammed, turn on SAAR, switch to Gleam S, overheat and pray.

DO NOT ORBIT. Use manual piloting to make opponents chase you, lowering their transversal. You will not hit anything on autopilot orbit as your transversal will be too high. If you get scrammed, turn on SAAR, switch to Gleam S, overheat and pray.

description.value: Probably good for solo pvp but it's designed to be bait in a cruiser gang, since vexors are engageable.

hardware.type: Medium Core Defense Field Extender I

description.value: Damage needs to be prioritized over tank, since the tank will never be strong enough for a prolonged match. Focus on melting the face.

Rails are for drones. The nos is so you can hold scram on a ship with bad tracking but heavy neuting power. This way, you'll be able to keep holding tackle on them no matter how many neutralizers are on you.

description.value: This is an anti-kite fit, so do not use rage rockets, as they apply damage poorly to fast, small targets. Use faction rockets instead.

Engagement profile: brawlers, scram-kiters. For scram kiters switch to barrage ammo. Do not engage kiters unless you have support/range advantage, you won't catch them. If you must fight a kiter, use Warrior IIs and only the armor repper. The OIS can be swapped with a SAR.
Scram kite everything. Don't use rage rockets on small fast ships, they apply poorly. Use faction rockets instead.
BLAP BLAP
BLAP BLAP

description.value: Keep at 7km, fight brawlers.

Designed to be be formidable at all ranges. Use the afterburner to get in optimal for the blasters and turn on the ADC to survive the brawl. The MWD will help you catch kiters. Scram kiters will be hard, just load Null ammo and turn on the ADC and you may make it through.
Will readily kill things larger than it. Use the autocannon for drones.

Medium Core Defense Field Extender I

description.value:
As with all hull tanked things, you generally have a choice between how much dps/tank you want.
5 MFS, 0 RB - 1211 DPS, 47.1k EHP
0 MFS, 5 RB - 746 DPS, 109k EHP

This variant is designed for longer engagements. Since you only have 1m21s with everything on, you may want to wait until you get into half structure to turn on the MAAR. After that, you have a bit more survivability and a chance to do 1m21s x 1022dps = 82k damage.
LNBs are for smaller targets that may be harassing you, use drones on big things. MJD to escape.
Imported from https://zkillboard.com/kill/86671641/
